N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 343.15 - Termination of certification

State Regulations
(a) Grounds. (1)

The division shall terminate
certification prior to expiration upon discovery of any of the circumstances
set forth in section
343.14
(e)(1)(i) through
(v) of this Part. (2)

The division may terminate certification
prior to expiration upon discovery of any of the circumstances set forth in
section
343.14
(f)(1)(i) through
(viii)
of this Part or if any of the terms of
the affirmation statement signed pursuant to section
343.9
have been violated, in
accordance with the following procedure: (i) The division shall inform the certified provider in writing of the
inappropriate activity or deficiency and shall notify such provider that it has
been placed on probationary status and that it must immediately cease and
desist all inappropriate activity or correct noted deficiencies, as applicable. Such notification shall also state that the certified provider must submit a
plan of correction within 30 days of receipt of the notification and in
accordance with division instructions. (ii)

After receipt of the required plan of
correction, the division shall conduct a follow-up on-site inspection of such
provider, or shall take other appropriate measures to determine plan
compliance. (iii)

If the division
determines that the plan of correction has been satisfactorily implemented, and
deficiencies no longer exist, probationary status shall be lifted and full
certification shall be restored. (iv)

If the plan of correction has not been
satisfactorily implemented and/or if deficiencies persist, certification shall
be terminated. The division shall send written notice of termination of
certification to the provider by certified mail, return receipt requested. Such
notice shall state that certification shall be invalid upon receipt of the
notice. Notes
